answers.author: Israel Murguia
answers.text:
Hi Pamela, 
From the question, I'm assuming what is meant are counties that do not pay sales taxes to the state on items that they purchase. I couldn't find a list of counties exempted from sales taxes on good that are necessary to run their governments. But with assistance from NACo, I am posting the following Georgia law that exempts counties from sales taxes. I assume other states have similarities to this one:  https://etax.dor.ga.gov/salestax/TLP_2010_List_of_Sales_and_Use_Tax_Exemptions.pdf 
In addition, the following is from New York which exempts its counties:  http://www.tax.ny.gov/pubs_and_bulls/tg_bulletins/st/purchases_and_sales_by_governmental_entities.htm 
I hope this helps.

author: Pamela Muse
text:
A California County is looking to see if there are any counties that do not pay sales tax?  Any information or referrals you can provide is appreciated.
Pamela Muse
Western Regional Director
Alliance for Innovation
888-468-6450
pmuse@transformgov.org
title: Do County's Pay Sales Tax?
